name: Coventry Motor Inn

reviews.text: We booked this one based on previous review and took the advice and asked for the buchanan St view when booking. That and the other advantage of off street parking included - which was a major thing as parking in SF is extremely limited and expensive - $30/day. The room was spacious, clean and the beds were comfy - make sure you ask for extra pillows as they are pretty flat. Had no problem getting into and out of the car park, even with our rental trailblazer - always had spaces available in the basement park. Very close to shops and attractions - 2 miles.
reviews.title: Ok stay at Coventry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was so quiet, we were very surprised! Be sure to request a room in the back..."Mouton Street" side. They really do keep good tabs on your requests because we didn't once have to remind them about anything. It was all there waiting for us. The rooms were a good size and so was the bathroom. The room was also very clean and the bed was comfortable. The view was an alley way, but we did not stay for the view. We stayed to spend the weekend in the city and sleep soundly at a good price.
reviews.title: So Quiet! So Friendly!

likes.liked: — Quiet, Clean, Internet, Beds, Location, Staff, Price, Saftey, The front desk apples!
likes.disliked: — Wish they had a pool, but not needed with the ocean near by in the warm months.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot tell you how nice the front desk people are. Check in/check out was a very fast experience. These people are prepared! It's they had been waiting for you to walk through the door all day. Wonderful!
reviews.title: Really an excellent motor inn

likes.disliked: — older carpets and furnature in the bedrooms could do with a bit of a make over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are so very glad we stayed here and will stay here again. It was a very good deal. We also felt very safe there. Something that I have not felt in other motels on Lombard or in other parts of the city.
reviews.title: great deal! can be noisy

likes.liked: — free parking and size of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel is close to everything and one block away from a major bus line that takes you through the heart of the city. Shopping is also close by. Union St is a must to look around. Perry's is a great place to eat breakfast as well. It's only three or so blocks away and the desk people let us park our car after we checked out just so we could experience Perry's. Parking here is safe and free!
reviews.title: What A Stay In The City By The Bay!

likes.liked: — Size Of Room, Room was always Clean

reviews.title: Good value for money
reviews.text: We stayed in this Motel for three nights following the good reviews on trip advisor, and we were not disappointed.
The main reason we chose this Motel over others was due to the fact it had free parking, which was a real plus. Also, we booked the Motel over the internet so we got a good price ([--])
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Exceptional Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Motel is in a really good location, with the famous Lombard Street 'Crookedest Street in the World' about a 20 min walk from the Motel (all uphill!!). You can also walk to Fishermans Wharf which is about 30 min walk.
reviews.title: Good priced, clean motel with good location

reviews.text: The Coventry is a good, basic motel. It is pretty outdated but very
reviews.title: Good Value
Great place!
reviews.text: clean. For the price ( with parking!), it is a great stay. The staff, especially Sherman at the front desk, was friendly and helpful. The location is our favorite in SF. It is walking distance form the Chestnut street shops and the Marina/Chrissy Field. If you have kids, you can't ask for a better location; there's even a great playground and library just blocks away.

We booked the Coventry for 3 nights, after a recommendation from the California Welcome Centre on Pier 39 (she rang up and sorted it out for us!) - it was a great place! Really friendly staff, free parking, large room, good bathroom / shower - easy to get around San Francisco using this as your base. Paid $89 for Saturday night, and $76 for the other nights, plus tax.
reviews.title: Thanks again Trip Advisor - Loved The Coventry

likes.disliked: — Funky tasting water - but not a problem thanks to bottled water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great value and very comfortable

description: The Coventry Motor Inn features spacious, tastefully decorated rooms. Rooms are available with your choice of one king, two queen, or two double beds to ensure your comfort.Each room has a comfortable, well lit seating and work area, individually controlled heat and air-conditioning, direct-dial phone, coffee maker, and color TV.Other conviniences include free covered parking and ready public transportation to all parts of the city.
